Title:
Two new Thai species of Moelleriella with perithecia in
tubercles
Abstract:
Two new species of Moelleriella were discovered during
diversity surveys of entomopathogenic fungi in the south of Thailand and
are described as M. alba and M. chumphonensis based on morphological
characters and molecular study. They have effuse white to orange
stromata. Their teleomorphs are unique in producing a single perithecium
inside a tubercle resembling Moelleriella raciborskii, a common species
in Thailand. A combined matrix of nuclear large subunit rRNA gene (LSU)
and RNA polymerase II subunit one (RPB1) gene shows that both species
cluster in a distinct lineage as sister to M. raciborskii/ï¿½A.ï¿½
placenta.
